oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A NONLINEAR SURF BEAT MODEL
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zhou, Zhili
Dodd, Nicholas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: surf beat
surf beat model
nonlinear model
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A nonlinear, short-wave-averaged (surf beat) model is presented. The model is based on that of Roelvink (1993), but the numerical techniques used in the solution are based on the so-called weighted-averaged flux (WAF) method (eg Watson et al, 1992), with time-operator splitting used for the treatment of some of the source terms. This method allows a small number of computational points to be used, and is particularly efficient in modelling breaking long waves. The short-wave (or primary-wave) energy equation is solved using a more traditional Lax-Wendroff technique. Results of validation indicate that the model performs satisfactorily in most respects.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
